results.title: Eighteen Footers [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Jack Rogers
results.brief_description: An exciting and visually beautiful study of yachting on Sydney Harbour, with special reference to the Australian designed eighteen footer, one of the speediest craft of its kind in the world. Describes the standard design, how it evolved and a number of variations. Portrays the exhilaration of racing the craft and demonstrates handling technique

results.title: Eighteen Footers [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Jack Rogers
results.brief_description: This film depicts sailing on Sydney Harbour in the locally designed eighteen foot open skiffs, fast four-man craft with unrestricted sail area. Describes the standard design and its evolution and shows the boats in action in a race illustrating handling technique

results.title: Eight out of ten
results.brief_description: In its appeals, the American Cancer Society has found that eight out of ten people will give money if properly approached. Here is shows how the successful first appeal of the Arizona section was run; from the recruiting of chairman and leaders, through publicity and education, to the vital face-to-face method of appeal.

results.title: Eight months to Mars
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: This film shows the problems encountered in sending Mariner IV 325 million miles through space to explore Mars. Designed to inform the layperson in terms which will be understood, the film also explains scientific readings and photographs from Mariner IV. Narrated by John Fitch.

results.title: Eight litres a minute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Battle for the planet”.
Profiles a serious form of air pollution in the West: acid rain particularly addressing the export of air pollution to the Third World as evidenced in Mexico and Brazil. As meaningful attempts seek to solve acid rain in Europe, European and North American corporations are relocating their dirty industries to countries with lower pollution standards. Third World governments admit polluters as they bring the promise of employment and wealth. Examines the impact on the people of Mexico City and the refinery city of Cubatao in Brazil. In both cities 45-50% of the major polluting companies are foreign and have been attracted by weak environmental legislation. In Mexico City, 20 million people, 3 million cars, 100,000 buses and thousands of trucks create an enormous pollution problem. In Cubatao, in the Amazon rainforest forest, air pollution, water pollution and soil degradation are in tragic dimensions with 30% of deaths caused by respiratory problems.

results.title: Egyptian villagers
results.brief_description: Examines the village and family life in a small Egyptian farming community, and the future for those who live in villages throughout the country. Illustrates how education brings social change, and the blend of ancient and modern farming methods and patterns.
results.description: Examines the village and family life in a small Egyptian farming community, and the future for those who live in villages throughout the country. Illustrates how education brings social change, and the blend of ancient and modern farming methods and patterns.

results.title: Egypt: the struggle for stability
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Antony Thomas
results.brief_description: Part of “The Arab Experience” series, this episode explains that Egypt is a study in contrast and conflict, a land of both water wheels and massive hydro-electric power facilities. It is a country with great potential in its natural resources and a level of poverty among the worst in the world.

results.title: Egypt: a new horizon
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and Alfred Wagg Pictures
results.brief_description: The River Nile has always been the key to Egypt’s economy. Today it is bringing a new horizon to Egypt. It is the source of hydro-electric power, and is vital to the projects of reclaiming previous arid land. Other Egyptian industries, and the tourist trade are discussed.

results.title: Egypt and the Nile
results.creator_credit: Donald G. Hoffman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a picture of Egypt and the Nile Valley as seen against its historical background. Emphasises the importance of the Nile River in the whole pattern of Egyptian life. Includes scenes of an ancient temple to the sun god at Abu Simbel, the dam at Aswan, the delta of the Nile, the Suez Canal, and the cities of Asyut, Cairo, and Alexandria.
